results.title: Dot goes to Hollywood
results.brief_description: Dot sets out on a mighty adventure which takes her to the razzle dazzle of sparkling Hollywood. Once there she becomes a film star to raise money for her little friend Gumley the koala who needs an operation on her eyes. With the help of Hollywood stars, Dot wins a talent quest and is discovered by a famous director, she becomes what all Hollywood dreams are made of - a star.

results.title: Dot and the Koala
results.brief_description: Dot and the Koala opens with the residents of a small Australian country town desperately wanting to lead more exciting, more modern lives. Major Percy Pig convinces the townspeople - a strange collection of haughty cows, hardworking horses and aggressive dogs - that the answer to their problems is a massive dam. The dam will provide the power to catapult the town into the 21st century. When the native animals - kangaroos, wombats and possums - realise the dam will destroy vast tracts of the countryside, open warfare erupts between the two groups.

results.title: Dot and the kangaroo
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: Dot, the little daughter of a settler in the Australian outback loses her way in the bush. Terrified by the dark shadows and unfamiliar sounds of the bush, she is soon befriended by a big kangaroo. Dot travels in the kangaroo’s pouch on an adventure packed journey. She meets many bush animals and birds - koala, platypus, kookaburra and other indigenous Australian creatures. She runs into danger as she and the kangaroo are chased by angry dingoes. There is tension and excitement until, with the help of the bush creatures, Dot finally finds her home and the kangaroo returns to her natural environment.

results.title: Double Take
results.creator_credit: Dan Roberts, Samuel Hodges, Sophie Vickers, Arms Around the Child, Greene Light Films and Channel 4
results.brief_description: Inspired by real-life events, ‘Double Take’ is a story of family rivalry and reconciliation along a trail of forgotten memories.

results.title: Dot and the Bunny
results.brief_description: Dot ventures into the bush determined to finally locate the little lost Joey and reunite him with his mother the kangaroo. On her way she meets a silly bunny rabbit who tries to convince Dot that he is the lost Joey she is looking for. Dot politely explains to her new friend that Joeys have pouches and long tails, just like other kangaroos. Determined to convince Dot, the bunny fashions a pouch and a tail for himself from some shrubs and leaves. Dot is delighted and nicknames him Funny Bunny. Together they set out to search for the lost Joey and Dot tries to console Funny Bunny by explaining how important bunnies are especially at Easter.

results.title: Dot and Santa Claus
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: When Dot tells Santa Claus all about her wish to find her friend the Kangaroo’s lost Joey he offers to help and the two take to the air in Santa’s sleigh, pulled by two kangaroos. Their quest takes them all around the world and at each stop Santa teaches Dot about special Christmas traditions, including the origin of the Christmas carol “Silent night”. A delightful and entertaining musical adventure that is sure to bring glad tidings to all.

results.title: Dot and Keeto
results.brief_description: Dot tumbles into a secret world when she shrinks to insect size in this enchanting tale. Dot and her new friend Keeto the Mosquito become involved in many adventures whilst searching for the secret bark that will return Dot to her normal size. Dot encounters many strange creatures during her searches, including the lovable Butterwalk the Caterpillar, Atlantis the Praying Mantis and the ruthless Queen Ant.

results.title: Double indemnity
results.creator_credit: Billy Wilder, Joseph Sistrom and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Double Indemnity is possibly the definitive film noir. It features a sharp, literate screenplay with great dialogue (Raymond Chandler worked on the script), a stylish, cool and erotic mise-en-scene by director Billy Wilder, and a stunning performance by Barbara Stanwyck who, in this film, is queen of the femme fatales. She plays a bewitching ice-princess who seduces a crooked insurance agent (Fred MacMurray) into helping her kill her husband to cash in on his insurance policy. This malevolant, spell-binding thriller is based on James M. Cain’s classic pulp novel. Cast also includes Edward G. Robinson.
